title: Adrian Peterson Open To Return To Vikings | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Adrian Peterson Open To Return To Vikings posted by Alexander Shun - share 
The Minnesota Vikings declined the 2017 option on running back Adrian Peterson's contract, making the 10-year pro an unrestricted free agent. 
Although the Vikings declined the 2017 option, that does not necessarily rule out Peterson playing for Minnesota next season, as the future Hall-of-Famer has already sent a note to ESPN's Josina Anderson saying that he would be open to returning to the purple and gold. Statement to me from Adrian Peterson: "It’s been a great 10 years with the Minnesota Vikings. They know what (cont) https://t.co/jd70qDqzao — Josina Anderson (@JosinaAnderson) February 28, 2017 
The complete statement from Peterson to Anderson is below. 
Statement to me from Adrian Peterson: "It’s been a great 10 years with the Minnesota Vikings. They know what I bring to the organization as a player, with my work ethic and dedication. I spoke with Rick Spielman this past weekend. The door is still open to find some common ground. I understand addressing the offensive line is one of their main priorities this offseason. In the meantime, I will explore my other options and see what path God leads me on. My main goal remains the same: to win a Super Bowl championship with a great team, which I also believe we have in Minnesota." Check out Vikings.com for more information and Minnesota Vikings coverage throughout the year! Contact
